title: Can't implement interface defined in same file

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Bug that shouldn't change language semantics when fixed.

body:
### Version Information

* vyper Version (output of `vyper --version`): 0.2.8+commit.069936f

### What's your issue about?

In asking about some related interface import issues on Discord, someone noted that code like the following should be expected to work:

```python
# @version >=0.2.8 <0.3.0

interface SomeInterface:
    def f(): nonpayable

implements: SomeInterface

@external
def f():
    pass
```

As it is it produces an error like: `vyper.exceptions.StructureException: Unknown interface specified: SomeInterface`

Please include information like:

* full output of the error you received
    ```
    Error compiling: example.vy
    vyper.exceptions.StructureException: Unknown interface specified: SomeInterface
      contract "example.vy", line 6:0
           5
      ---> 6 implements: SomeInterface
      -------^
           7
    ```
* what command you ran
    `vyper example.vy` on a file containing the sample above
* the code that caused the failure (see [this link](https://help.github.com/articles/basic-writing-and-formatting-syntax/) for help with formatting code)


### How can it be fixed?

As a possibly related issue:

If `SomeInterface.vy` contains:
```python
# @version >=0.2.8 <0.3.0

interface SomeInterface:
    def f(): nonpayable
```

And I run `vyper -f abi SomeInterface.vy`, the only output is `[]`

> As a possibly related issue:
> 
> If `SomeInterface.vy` contains:
> 
> ```python
> # @version >=0.2.8 <0.3.0
> 
> interface SomeInterface:
>     def f(): nonpayable
> ```
> 
> And I run `vyper -f abi SomeInterface.vy`, the only output is `[]`

So the problem here is that you've defined an interface, but haven't implemented anything that uses it. For the "interface files" you basically do something like this instead:

`SomeInterface.vy`:
```python
@external
def f():
    ...
```

`MyContract.vy`:
```python
from . import SomeInterface

# use SomeInterface in some way
```

Kind of weird, I know

@fubuloubu - Thanks. That's where I ended up with it (and then generating json abi into the `interfaces/` directory for use by other components as I had some issue importing a full contract w/ structs defined).

Wasn't sure what was unexpected vs me just being new and not understanding the right way to do things :+1:
